title: 113_hr5290
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Creating Opportunities for Military Members to Use Transportation Efficiently Act of 2014" or the "COMMUTE Act of 2014." It includes provisions for the Military Community Infrastructure Program. The Military Community Infrastructure Program, established under the "Creating Opportunities for Military Members to Use Transportation Efficiently Act of 2014," allows the Secretary to provide grants for transportation infrastructure projects in military communities. Eligible entities must submit applications for projects like road construction, mass transit facilities, and pedestrian/bicycle access upgrades. The Military Community Infrastructure Program, established under the "Creating Opportunities for Military Members to Use Transportation Efficiently Act of 2014," provides grants for transportation infrastructure projects in military communities. Eligible projects must improve access to military installations in urbanized areas designated as growth communities. Considerations for grant awards include the magnitude of the problem addressed and the proportion of the problem tackled by the project. The Military Community Infrastructure Program provides grants for transportation projects in military communities. Considerations for grant awards include the proportion of the problem caused by military installation growth, the number of affected servicemembers and employees, community size, entity's ability to execute the project, and the project's impact on resolving transportation issues. The Federal share of project costs cannot exceed 80 percent. SEC. 3. TRAFFIC IMPACT STUDY.

The Secretary must conduct a traffic impact study for urbanized areas expecting increased traffic due to military installations. The study will identify necessary transportation improvements for military personnel commuting to the installation. Consultation with relevant planning organizations and military commanders is required.

SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "eligible entity" includes a State, public transportation operator, local governmental authority, metropolitan planning organization, or regional transportation planning organization. The terms "metropolitan planning organization" and "regional transportation planning organization" are defined in section 134(b) of title 23, United States Code. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary conducting traffic impact studies for urbanized areas with increased traffic due to military installations. The term "Secretary" in this Act refers to the Secretary of Defense, acting through the Director of the Office of Economic Adjustment. The term "State" includes each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and any territory or possession of the United States. Authorization of appropriations for this Act includes $200,000,000 for fiscal year 2015 and $100,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2016 to 2019, to remain available until expended.
